title: [BUG] Distutils was imported before Setuptools, but importing Setuptools also replaces the `distutils` module in `sys.modules`
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
On following instructions for installation of [development version](https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/installation.html) I get the following error:
![img](https://i.imgur.com/QMY1m4o.png[/img)

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

System Information:
```bash
Distributor ID:	Pop
Description:	Pop!_OS 21.10
Release:	21.10
Codename:	impish
```
Details about conda environmnet:
<details>

Open python on terminal and enter:

```python3
from sktime import show_versions
show_versions()
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
Giving the version of sktime used without throwing errors.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
A workaround which worked for me was to follow dev instructions using Python3.9 and venv (instead of conda). Do not know why this worked and conda did not

**Versions**
<details>

